title: Special-Rcology
text:
🛠️ This is a Quarto website still in development. 🏗️

Setup
You can easily contribute via github by following these steps:

“Low key contribution”: Just leave a comment on the article you want to enhance. This is especially wanted for general feedback (structure, content etc.)!
“I want to add notes myself!”

No problem! It’s very easy, really. To get started, watch this video for 2 minutes and you’re good to go!
Here’s a transcript of what to do:

Create a github account here!
Install git on your machine.
Go to the project’s website repository.
Fork it by clicking the button on the top right!
After linking the forked repo to your account, clone/download the files at your desired destination using:

git clone https://github.com/soekni/Special-Rcology.git
in your terminal/console. Make sure to open the terminal at your desired location or change the directory using the “cd locationToYourPath”.

Now you’re good to go! Change/Add files/notes using Quarto. Check out this article for learning the basics of markdown to just get started! If you want to learn more about authoring content/styling, this is the article to go.



Further reading
To learn more about Quarto websites visit https://quarto.org/docs/websites.

title: The Idea
text:
The aim of this site is simple:
Gather up useful information on R, Ecology and Statistics here.
Use it as a “cheat sheet” or digital garden for basic knowledge.
You can help by participating or pointing out mistakes by commenting.
